project

Summary
Almost everything is managed within the context of a project. For example: the depots, product catalogs, and orders are all managed by project. Although two projects may define depots with the same name, each project will actually have their own separate depot.


Fields Type Attributes Description
active  boolean required
  		Inactive projects are generally hidden from view, however, they are still visible to administrators.  
businessDays  dayFrequency   The nominal business days (e.g.: Monday through Friday). This may be displayed to customers.  
businessEndTime  time required
  		The nominal end of business hours. This may be displayed to customers.  
businessStartTime  time required
  		The nominal start of business hours. This may be displayed to customers.  
catalogVersion  integer required
audit disabled   		An internal version number for the product catalog. This is incremented any time a new version of a product or price sheet is published. This provides a simple way to coordinate in-memory caches.  
code  projectCode
max length: 5
allows letters
allows digits 		required
  		The unique code that identifies this project.

Also, this code is used as a prefix for various numbers within the project. For example: sales orders and tickets.

The code can be modified, but this is generally not recommended. Preexisting numbers are NOT updated when the code is updated and this can result in long confusion long term.  
companyName  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		required
  		The name of the company resposible for this project. This may be used on various documents such as emails and pick lists.  
createdLocalDate  date abstract
  		The created date based on the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTime  time abstract
  		The created time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The created timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The created timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
createdUtcTs  timestamp required
audit disabled   		The time this record was originally created.  
displayString  abstractText
max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		A human readable semi-unique value used to identify each model. This typically uses something like the model's name or code which is expected to be unique enough to distinish between the different values within a particular project.  
lockVersion  lockVersion audit disabled   This is used to coordinate optimistic locking in the database. This is usually not displayed.  
name  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		required
  		The display name.  
sendEmailFrom  email
max length: 50
allows printable 		required
  		The email address that all project emails will be sent FROM.  
uid  uid
max length: 30
allows printable 		primary key
required
  		The global unique key. This is a large hex-encoded number, and is usually not displayed to users. This is currently NOT a standard format, but is instead a format that we use internally.  
updatedLocalDate  date abstract
  		The updated date based on the user's local timezone.  
updatedLocalTime  time abstract
  		The updated time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
updatedLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The updated timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
updatedLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The updated timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
updatedUtcTs  timestamp required
audit disabled   		The time this record was last updated.
